meanings.definition: A person who follows or subscribes to the teachings or beliefs of another.
meanings.sent1: The young boy was a loyal follower of his favorite superhero.
meanings.sent2: She became a follower of the new exercise trend after seeing its benefits.
meanings.sent3: The cat, a follower of the sun, always found the warmest spot in the house.
meanings.sent4: The river, a faithful follower of gravity, flowed steadily towards the sea.
meanings.sent5: The student, a dedicated follower of knowledge, spent hours in the library every day.

meanings.definition: A person who supports or admires a particular person or group.
meanings.sent1: As a follower of the local band, she attended all their concerts.
meanings.sent2: He was a loyal follower of his favorite sports team, never missing a game.
meanings.sent3: The dog, a follower of treats, wagged its tail eagerly at the sound of a treat bag.
meanings.sent4: The wind, a silent follower of the storm, whispered warnings through the trees.
meanings.sent5: The artist, a passionate follower of creativity, found inspiration in everyday life.

meanings.definition: A mechanical device that tracks or moves in response to another object.
meanings.sent1: The drone acted as a follower, mirroring the movements of the main aircraft.
meanings.sent2: The robotic vacuum cleaner was designed to be a follower behind its user.
meanings.sent3: The toy car, a playful follower, zoomed around the room following the remote control.
meanings.sent4: The satellite, a high-tech follower, orbited the Earth in sync with its target.
meanings.sent5: The camera drone, a versatile follower, captured stunning aerial footage of the landscape.
